description: Intensive study of musical literature between 1750 and 1900. The course begins with the
development of the Viennese Classical School (Haydn, Mozart, Beethoven) and continues
with European trends in Romantic opera, Lieder, symphony and chamber music (from Rossini
through R. Strauss). Prerequisites: Music 241, 242.  Offered Fall Semester 2009-10 and alternate
fullname: Music Of The Classical And Romantic Eras
